item.title: Fores - 1983 - Science and the ‘Neolithic Paradox’
item.description: Fores, M. (1983). Science and the ‘Neolithic Paradox.’ History of Science, 21(2), 141–163. https://doi.org/10.1177/007327538302100202 Michael Fores wrote in such a way that his texts would only be cheaped by added commentary:

item.title: Michael Lynch on Expertise
item.description: The problem has to do with how Collins and Evans purport to ==settle== the reality question ==themselves== on the basis of their analytical judgments, ==rather than leaving it open to determination by participants and procedures in the institutions that social scientists investigate.

item.title: Review: Lynch (1993) Scientific practice and ordinary action
